page.title: 01Farmland around Whithorn
page.content: This land, to the North and East of Whithorn, is predominantly enclosed rough pasture, grazed by dairy cattle, mostly Ayrshires and Friesians with a few Belted Galloways. The land is hillocky and generally poor quality, although there are some wheat fields. The wheat is harvested using combine harvesters and baled into large cylinders or into oblongs stacked into triangles. Whithorn is a small agricultural town with mostly pre-war (1939) houses with solid wall construction but has a small council estate of modern cavity wall houses. There is an above average number of houses and shops for sale. A local church has been converted to a garage with petrol station.
